title: E'grus, the Spiteful Sprite (UNIQUE Lightning/Wind champion concept)
body:
**E’grus, the Spiteful Sprite**


**Passive: Static Electricity**
E’grus’ auto attacks charge his targets with static electricity.  Lasts for three seconds or until it is consumed by E’grus’ first damaging ability.
Ranged auto attacks deal reduced damage however, E’grus has a high base attack speed.

**Q: Superbolt** (natural phenomenon, a rare lightning strike that is far brighter)
After charging briefly, E’grus fires a lightning bolt to a selected target dealing magic damage. If there are enemies nearby within a small radius, who are charged with Static Electricity, the lightning bolt then jumps to the nearest enemy(prioritising champions) dealing magic damage and then traveling again and so forth. For each new enemy the lightning bolt strikes, the cooldown of the ability is lowered by a second. (E’grus’ main source of wave clear and damage).

**W (toggle): Writhing Winds**
Stance 1: Increased movement speed. E’grus leaves behind a wind trail that boosts allied champions movement speed when walking through it. Wind trail has a short lifetime. (As E’grus has little cc, this is his main mode of escape, but also allows for some unique benefits for your fellow jungler when it comes to roaming to other lanes for ganks).

Stance 2: Swirling winds form beneath E’grus covering a medium sized circular area. This area applies a weak slow to enemies that enter. While this mode is active, auto attack range is increased substantially. This bonus range increases with the level of the ability starting off as a minor extension as to avoid a strong lane phase.

**E: Lightning Tether**
E’grus fires a super charged gust at targeted enemy champion, dealing magic damage and applying a weak slow. If there are other enemy champions within a small radius, with Static Electricity, the gust travels to the nearest enemy, and so forth.  Once two enemies are connected they are stunned for a short duration.

**R: Electrostatic Cyclone**
E’grus channels for a few seconds, creating a large ring of spiralling wind and lightning over targeted area, dealing magic damage over time and drastically slowing enemies caught inside. The thickness of the ring is less than 425 so if caught inside, can be flashed out to avoid the detrimental effects.
http://fav.me/d9odac0
E’grus is a powerful mage who excels in team fights. His core visual concept is based on a sprite (meteorological and mythological) sitting in a twister, bearing lightning and wind as his weapons. His core playstyle concept is his passives interaction with his Q and E abilities. His playstyle is based around auto attacking multiple enemies before using his abilities for maximum aoe damage, therefore the more enemies in close proximity that are grouped up, the more damage he is able to dish out. Counter play to this would be keeping your distance from his auto range, your allies or to cleanse/QSS the passive. His W gives him some means of mobility or enhanced team fighting, by being able to reach the back line potentially with his auto’s and then using his mid-range abilities. The length of his auto range when in his second stance at level 5 would match his Q and E ability distance. Adjusting the max auto range would be a good way to balance him. His ultimate excels in team fights, especially ones centred near baron and dragon pits, thus increasing his team fight potential. I designed him to be a high risk, high reward champion requiring a high skill cap to master and achieve the most DPS. Depending on the projectile speed of his Q and E, a mechanic where using one of the spells on an enemy, and as its traveling proc the passive on nearby enemies would arise giving him more depth.
http://fav.me/d9odark
E’grus is the shepherd of the clouds, and the embodiment of the majestic winds swirling over Valoran. With Zaun’s disregard for the sky above, it has allowed its city to spew its pollution into air unchecked, smothering the clouds in filth, toxins and dark magic’s. With Zaun’s relentless pursue for power, no one on Valoran can halt its greed, and so the burden has risen to the shepherd above, E’grus.
Friends – Anivia, for some good banter about storms.
Rivals – everyone in Zaun!
“This cities disregard for the sky knows no bounds, as does my resolve”.

Thank you for taking the time to read my champion idea. My drawing isn’t that great but I have tried as best I can to show the basic concept of this champion and his abilities.
